Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY ?; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Flask with handles
Description: This flask in alabaster comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Rifeh. In a flat and slightly oval form, the piece is characterised by two handles placed where the neck and the belly touch. The flask, which has been restored, probably dates from the 18th Dynasty.
